# Activate SSO authentication

## By UI, from System > Configuration > SAML-based Single Sign-On (EE only)
* Enable SSO
* Complete configuration with following values (example for local development)
  * Entity ID: `http://localhost:8082/simplesaml/saml2/idp/metadata.php`
  * Sign On URL: `http://localhost:8082/simplesaml/saml2/idp/SSOService.php`
  * Logout URL: `http://localhost:8082/simplesaml/saml2/idp/SingleLogoutService.php`
  * Certificate: ``
* Save the configuration

## By Symfony command
* Run the command (example for local development): `bin/console akeneo:sso:activate http://localhost:8082/simplesaml/saml2/idp/metadata.php http://localhost:8082/simplesaml/saml2/idp/SSOService.php http://localhost:8082/simplesaml/saml2/idp/SingleLogoutService.php `

# Deactivate SSO authentication

## By UI, from System > Configuration > SAML-based Single Sign-On (EE only)
* Disable SSO 
* Save the configuration

## By Symfony command
* Run the command: `bin/console akeneo:sso:deactivate`
